citations.narrative:
On the mammal food shelf that was a small accumulation of rodent droppings. While the facility has instituted some
rodent traps, it does not seem to be an effective method of pest control. The presence of insect and mammal pests may
create a disease hazard to the animal. A safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian
and mammalian pests shall be established and maintained.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The current environmental enhancement plan does not have a plan for individually housed social species of birds that are
unable to see and hear birds of their own or compatible species. One peregrine falcon was moved to an indoor enclosure
where no other birds can be seen or heard. Without such an environmental enhancement plan, this bird may develop
abnormal behaviors and could experience psychological distress. The facility must develop, document, and implement an
adequate enrichment plan with the attending veterinarian's approval for all their birds, including special attention regarding
enhancement of the environment of those individually housed social species of birds that are unable to see and hear birds
of their own or compatible species.
To be corrected by: 29-January-2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.131(d)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
On the mammal food shelf that was a small accumulation of rodent droppings. While the facility has instituted some 
rodent traps, it does not seem to be an effective method of pest control. The presence of insect and mammal pests may 
create a disease hazard to the animal. A safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian 
and mammalian pests shall be established and maintained. 
3.154(c)(4) 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The current environmental enhancement plan does not have a plan for individually housed social species of birds that are 
unable to see and hear birds of their own or compatible species. One peregrine falcon was moved to an indoor enclosure 
where no other birds can be seen or heard. Without such an environmental enhancement plan, this bird may develop 
abnormal behaviors and could experience psychological distress. The facility must develop, document, and implement an 
adequate enrichment plan with the attending veterinarian's approval for all their birds, including special attention regarding 
enhancement of the environment of those individually housed social species of birds that are unable to see and hear birds 
of their own or compatible species. 
To be corrected by: 29-January-2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
